alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty; Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 09 at 8:00AM EST until March 09 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Gulf County in the Panhandle of Florida... South central Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... Northwestern Wakulla County in Big Bend of Florida... Southern Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... Northwestern Franklin County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 830 AM EST/730 AM CST/. * At 800 AM EST/700 AM CST/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Stonemill Creek to 7 miles south of Wewahitchka to near Mexico Beach, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Mexico Beach, Stonemill Creek, Orange, Wewahitchka, East Camp, Honeyville, Jewel Fire Tower, Vilas, Chipola Cutoff, Jensen Place, Central City, Red Hill, Overstreet, Poplar Camp, Kern, Willis Landing, Nixon Garden, Twin Pole, Dalkeith and Saint Joe Beach. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EST/800 AM CST/ for the Panhandle of Florida. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 100 PM EST/noon CST/ for Big Bend of Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EST/800 AM CST/ for the Panhandle of Florida. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 100 PM EST/noon CST/ for Big Bend of Florida.
